posts.cooked: Hi, We are trying to use an Arudino Uno board for the first time to use IR Beam Breakers. We were having some trouble with setting it the wiring and code to communicate to the roborio and by extension wpilib. How do you do that?

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
I’m surely not the one to get you to the finish line here, but: What interface are you using on the roboRIO side?  That’ll help the diagnosis a bit.

(Also, are you sure this isn’t something the roboRIO itself can support?)

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.custom_user_title: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.cooked: What do you mean by interface?

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked:
Were you connecting the beam break to the DIO pins, PWM pins, serial etc.

BTW, using an arduino is possible,  but way overkill.
We found that we need to connect it to an Arduino, but is it possible to do it directly to the roborio?

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: The roborio has DIO ports that you can use to connect sensors to it, on of them is a beam breaks.
Does that work for the andymark beam break too?
